drupalNodeEvent.title: U.S. - China Agriculture Roundtable Opening Ceremony

field_speakers.processed: Krysta Harden (CEO of USDEC), Dr. Elsa Murano (Director of the Borlaug Institute; President Emerita-Texas A&M), Polly Ruhland (CEO of United States Soybean Board), Bill Even (CEO of National Pork Board), Erik Fyrwald (CEO of Syngenta), Dr. Rattan Lal (Ohio State University), Juan Luciano (CEO of ADM), John May (CEO of John Deere), Lloyd Wright (Founder of National Organization of Professional Black NRCS Employees)

field_organizers.processed: US Heartland China Association, Chinese Academy of Social Sciences, The Carter Center

field_description.processed: The USHCA strongly believes that agriculture is a key area that has the potential to accelerate a climate-wise recovery for America, as well as being a stabilizing bedrock of the important US-China bilateral relationship going forward. To that end, the USHCA is organizing the first virtual US - China Agriculture Roundtable. We hope you join the first part of the event, the March 23rd Opening Celebration, and forward to those in your community and those who might be interested:
